Table of Contents

Name


CplantMyNid, CplantMyPpid, CplantMyRank,
CplantMyPid, CplantMySize, CplantMyJobId,
CplantMyPBSid, CplantMyNidMap, CplantMyPidMap

Synopsis


#include <cplant.h> int CplantMyNid(void)
int CplantMyPPid(void)
int CplantMyRank(void)
int CplantMyPid(void)
int CplantMySize(void)
int CplantMyJobId(void)
int CplantMyPBSid(void)
int *CplantMyNidMap(void)
int *CplantMyPidMap(void)

Description


The function CplantMyNid returns the physical node ID of the caller, and CplantMyPPid returns the portals process ID. These are the identifiers required by the message passing routines in the Cplant portals library. CplantMyPid returns the callers Linux system process ID. The function CplantMyRank returns the rank of the caller in it's parallel application. Process ranks are zero-based. CplantMySize returns the number of processes in it's parallel application. The function CplantMyJobId returns the Cplant job ID for the parallel application, and CplantMyPBSid returns the PBS ID of the PBS job that started the application. (A single PBS job can start many Cplant jobs.) CplantMyNidMap returns the list of physical node IDs of the calling application in process rank order, and CplantMyPidMap returns the associated list of portal process IDs. These lists may be freed by the caller when they are no longer needed.

Errors

The functions do not have error conditions, since these values are always
defined for a running Cplant application. If a non-PBS job requests it's
PBS job ID, an invalid ID of -1 will be returned.

See Also
